snippet: The Zuni Native American tribe has been active in reclaiming ceremonial objects, and is now making a moral case to museums beyond the reach of federal law.
abstract: Native American Zuni tribe from New Mexico is making moral plea for European museums to return art and artifacts considered sacred to tribe; Zuni and other Native American tribes have taken advantage of federal legislation that requires all United States institutions to return such ceremonial objects to individual tribes or risk losing funding, but laws do not apply in Europe.
lead_paragraph: The Zuni Native American tribe has been active in reclaiming ceremonial objects, and is now making a moral case to museums beyond the reach of federal law.

headline.main: Zuni Ask Europe to Return Sacred Art
headline.print_headline: Zuni Ask Europe to Return Sacred Art
